Text:
u compress it to a .tar and then you re-compress it to .gz so we have to un-compress it twice.. u fucking cock-a-roach..
the difference is only 110-120 MB for a 2.7GB file..
anyway thanks for sharing..

Those of us who weren't born yesterday *AHEM* SAS9211 *AHEM* know that gzip only accepts a single file. So, you use tar to "ball" files together. tar doesn't do any compression on its own...tar/gz has been a standard thing for a couple of decades now...

Ignore silly rabbits that complain about free stuff...they complain about the weather yet do nothing about it.
Thanks!
